definitions.definition: a person who supports or speaks in favour of somebody or of a public plan or action

examples.text: a staunch advocate of free speech
Canada was one of the strongest advocates of sanctions.
She became a firm advocate of overseas ventures.

definitions.definition: a person who defends somebody in court

examples.text: Solicitors often appear as advocates in the lower courts.
Those charged should be represented by trained, qualified legal advocates.

definitions.definition: (in Scotland and South Africa) a lawyer who has the right to argue cases in higher courts
